title: Create a low-level interface for websocket transcription

title: Fix url handling
body:
<!-- 
############################################# NOTICE #############################################

For the majority of situations, please use the dev branch as the base for your pull request.
We only update the main branch when we release a new version of the package.

More info: https://github.com/deepgram-devs/deepgram-rust-sdk/wiki/Branches

##################################################################################################
-->

## Proposed changes

<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue. -->

The current implementation double-escapes query parameters passed in `crate::common::Options`.  This uses proper formencoded parsing instead of string splitting, so the escaping only happens once.

I also introduce a pub fn urlencoded to match the other api endpoints, and to help demonstrate the erroneous behavior.

## Types of changes

<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce to the Deepgram Rust SDK? -->

<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update or tests (if none of the other choices apply)

## Checklist

<!-- You can also fill these out after creating the PR. If you're unsure about any of them, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! This is simply a reminder of what we are going to look for before merging your code. -->

<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply. -->
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md) doc
- [x] I have added tests and/or examples that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] I have added necessary documentation (if appropriate)

title: SDK Update and Refactor
body:
## Proposed changes

- Add streaming features
- Add support for pre-recorded features when streaming
- Add Speech to Text
- Refactor Code

### Streaming Features
- endpointing
- utterance_end_ms
- interim_results
- no_delay
- vad_events

### Streaming Functions
- keep_alive

### New Streaming Message Types
- Utterance End
- Speech Started

### Pre-Recorded Features
- encoding
- smart_format
- callback
- callback_method
- filler_words
- paragraphs
- diarize_version
- dictation
- measurements
- extra

### Pre-Recorded Audio Intelligence Features
- detect_entities
- sentiment
- topics
- summarize
- intents
- custom_intents
- custom_intent_mode
- topics
- custom_topics
- custom_topic_mode

## Types of changes
- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [x] Documentation update or tests (if none of the other choices apply)

## Checklist

<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply. -->
- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING.md](../CONTRIBUTING.md) doc
- [x] I have added tests and/or examples that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] I have added necessary documentation (if appropriate)

## Further comments

Also considered a different approach with a SerializeStreamingOptions and have the code still just in case but this followed existing patterns

---
- To see the specific tasks where the Asana app for GitHub is being used, see below:
  - https://app.asana.com/0/0/1207792457320343

title: Custom hosts
body:
<!-- 
############################################# NOTICE #############################################

For the majority of situations, please use the dev branch as the base for your pull request.
We only update the main branch when we release a new version of the package.

More info: https://github.com/deepgram-devs/deepgram-rust-sdk/wiki/Branches

##################################################################################################
-->

## Proposed changes

Support connecting to deepgram hosts at URLs other than `https://api.deepgram.com`.  This will help us support self-hosted users, as well as supporting in-house development.

title: Featurize transcription modes
body:
<!-- 
############################################# NOTICE #############################################

For the majority of situations, please use the dev branch as the base for your pull request.
We only update the main branch when we release a new version of the package.

More info: https://github.com/deepgram-devs/deepgram-rust-sdk/wiki/Branches

##################################################################################################
-->

## Proposed changes

Add feature flags for `live` and `prerecorded` ASR.  This helps non-streaming users not have to import tungstenite.  I'm open to not doing things this way.  I'm thinking of also following up with a little more specificity about which tokio features to include for similar reasons.

title: Deprecate tiers and use fully-qualified model variants.
body:
<!-- 
############################################# NOTICE #############################################

For the majority of situations, please use the dev branch as the base for your pull request.
We only update the main branch when we release a new version of the package.

More info: https://github.com/deepgram-devs/deepgram-rust-sdk/wiki/Branches

##################################################################################################
-->

## Proposed changes

Deepgram no longer relies on explicit "tiers" to identify models.  Instead, the tier name is included in the model param.  This PR removes tiers, deprecates implicit-architecture usecase model variants, and adds variants for all current architectures.

<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue. -->

## Types of changes

<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce to the Deepgram Rust SDK? -->

title: refactor!: remove generic from `Deepgram`
body:
The `Deepgram` struct is unnecessarily generic. Storing the API key as a generic offers flexibility which probably isn't warranted by any use cases.

Fixes #49

title: fix(streaming): hard-coded uri
body:
We build a URI to use with the user's specified
encoding/sample_rate/channels, but we never used it.

This also fixes an issue by making the future returned by `start()` `Send`.

Fixes #45

## Proposed changes

<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue. -->

Add a test to the CI workflow that checks to help catch any accidental semantic versioning violations. Uses [`cargo-semver-checks`](https://crates.io/crates/cargo-semver-checks).

## Types of changes

<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce to the Deepgram Rust SDK? -->

<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->
- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [x] Documentation update or tests (if none of the other choices apply)

title: Derive `Serialize` for all response types
body:
**Why?**
Fixes #27.

title: Fix crate::keys::options::OptionsBuilder::time_to_live_in_seconds docs
body: The docs for `OptionsBuilder::time_to_live_in_seconds` were originally copied from `OptionsBuilder::expiration_date`, but I forgot to actually change them until now.

title: Use String instead of &str where possible
body:
If types contain a `&'a str`, there lifetime is limited to `'a`. This is frustrating when the user would like the type to have a `'static` lifetime. Storing the data as a `String` instead fixes this problem because `String`s always have a `'static` lifetime. There will be some overhead associated with this change, but it will almost always be negligible.

[This has been discussed before](https://github.com/deepgram-devs/deepgram-rust-sdk/pull/1#discussion_r879829601), but I've been putting it off until all the branches have been consolidated in order to avoid a million merge conflicts. Well, that day is today.

title: Make AudioSource a type rather than a trait
body:
This change makes it easier to work with the SDK if it isn't known until runtime whether you'll be using a URL source or a buffer source. This was based off of a recommendation from @ChristopherBiscardi in [this video](https://youtu.be/abdEyc9LyhU) from the experience of building [Lamarck](https://github.com/ChristopherBiscardi/lamarck).

Originally I had avoided using an enum because putting generics on enums can be a nightmare for the user of the library, but @jcdyer pointed out a way to do it without generics entirely.

title: General community housekeeping
body: Few community clean-up items. Great job on having 95% of what we look for!

title: Define the remaining modules and clients for the API
body:
The organizational structure is identical to the [Deepgram API Reference](https://developers.deepgram.com/api-reference/).

Generating a specialized client from the `Deepgram` client is similar to how our existing SDKs work.

---

The following pull requests should be merged before this one:

 - #7

title: More upfront breaking changes
body:
Some more breaking changes we can make in a release that's already going to be breaking (`0.1` -> `0.2`) so that once they become relevant, they won't cause a breaking update. Similar to #6.

 - [x] Remove the `Eq` and `Hash` traits from types that might have unsupported fields in the future
 - [x] Seal the `AudioSource` trait

title: Make the transcription module
body: This module will contain the code used for transcription, keeping it separate from other parts, such as API key management, billing, etc.

title: Upfront breaking changes
body:
Some breaking changes we can make in a release that's already going to be breaking (`0.1` -> `0.2`) so that once they become relevant, they won't cause a breaking update.

 - [x] Make structs that might get more fields in the future `#[non_exhaustive]`
 - [x] Remove the `Copy` trait from the aforementioned structs

title: Add a script for maintaining the version
body:
**This commit**
* add the `version` script which bumps the version in `Cargo.toml` and
  modifies the `README.md`

**Why?**
For convenience.

title: Add link to Search feature docs to Hit docs
body: Based on some user feedback from @LarWong. When looking through the docs, it wasn't quite clear what a `Hit` was. Adding a link to the Search feature should make this more clear.

title: Move reqwest stream feature to normal dependencies
body:
Previously it was just in the `dev-dependencies`, since it technically isn't needed to compile our library crate by itself.
However, it seems like it will be pretty common for people to want to send files, which requires the stream feature.

Users could enable the stream feature in their own dependencies, but since it's not obvious that that's the solution, it seems best to enable it here.

title: Implement an interface for the prerecorded API
